pr_title: Upgrade the cook, and a few more recipes

timeline.message: Add clay block to clay ball conversion to crusher
Enable crafters to better handle 'tools' like pots

timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: I'm nt a fan at all of this. Adding a lot of automatic recipes slows down the colony (each time a request is executed all recipes have to be checked). Why do we need this explicitly?
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: In a vanilla world, we really don't. Once you add in modpacks, there are a lot of recipes that require cooked foods that can't be fulfilled today. As we discussed in Discord, I'll look at the temporary recipe via resolver.
replies.author: Mekle001

timeline.message: Add recipe lookup support for output
Add on-demand recipe support for smelting

timeline.bodyText: I would only query this if ISFOOD
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Given that we don't know what the item is until after the query, I'm not sure how to limit it. We could do a combined predicate, though I don't see any advantage to that, and this code is clearer.
replies.author: Mekle001

replies.bodyText: I think there was one getFirstRecipe that gets an itemStack too. Where we could intercept.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I had done that, and pulled it, because it's used rarely, and at the abstract level it just wraps the predicate version.  That is actually what I did first, and it didn't actually let things work, because the predicate is used almost everywhere.
replies.author: Mekle001
